downloadDescription: Create a test lab to demonstrate DirectAccess with a simulated Internet, intranet, and home network.
detailsSection: DirectAccess is a new feature in the Windows® 7 and Windows Server® 2008 R2 operating systems that enables remote users to securely access intranet shared folders, Web sites, and applications without connecting to a virtual private network (VPN). This document contains an introduction to DirectAccess and step-by-step instructions for extending the Base Configuration test lab to demonstrate DirectAccess in Windows Server 2008 R2 with a simulated Internet, intranet, and home network.
systemRequirementsSection: Windows 7 Ultimate; Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise Edition; Microsoft Word
installInstructionSection: Click Download to download this document.

relatedResourcesSection.title: test Lab Guide: Demonstrate DirectAccess with Network Access Protection (NAP)
